data.text:
This July, leaders will gather in Rome, Italy to launch bold action to transform #FoodSystems & advance the #GlobalGoals.

More on the announcement: https://t.co/yLp5DKfCmB https://t.co/jiZaPm2CTX

"Now that we have vaccines, this misinformation battle is more urgent than ever."

-- UN communications chief @MelissaFleming on the continued need to share reliable, scientific information amid the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/iLr5ML1Rdm https://t.co/fBUCTChooU

Yemen: "I see shocking reports of children increasingly getting drawn into the war effort and deprived of their future."

@OSE_Yemen Martin Griffiths briefed the Security Council on the dire situation in the country. https://t.co/ZlwHxGB0lx

"The social & economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic has been devastating for women’s rights."

-- @antonioguterres calls for a reset to ensure everyone enjoys the right to life, dignity & security on a healthy planet. https://t.co/DcPtDI8sXT

Rwanda is one of the 1st countries in Africa to include refugees in their national roll-out of #COVID19 vaccines.

@Refugees urges governments to ensure their pandemic response plans take into account refugees and internally displaced & stateless people.  https://t.co/UHszXPkCJ7

"It's never a good idea to exclude half your talent from contributing to your goals. Every society needs to be able to count on the full & effective participation of women & girls." 

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet at #CSW65. https://t.co/wjkFAAFEAq

"We are deeply disturbed that the crackdown continues to intensify, and we again call on the military to stop killing and detaining protestors."

-- @UNHumanRights amid increasing violence against protesters in Myanmar. https://t.co/3pnEkVycBF

The world needs to commit to deliver affordable & clean energy for all by 2030. ⚡

@SEforALLorg is urging decision-makers to prioritize sustainable energy for all. Join them in calling for bolder #ClimateAction 👉 https://t.co/HkDvFmgnIk https://t.co/IczjQcUCj1

The impacts of #COVID19 extend beyond the health crisis and include issues such as the economic downturn and worsening civil unrest.

@UNDP says the fallout from the pandemic is increasing people's vulnerability. https://t.co/AFHzTDmFn5

"Those who have no food, no shelter, how can they think about education?"

-- @UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador @muzoonrakan1 appeals for help for the Syrian people as the conflict there enters its 11th year. https://t.co/7StMopnBDm https://t.co/92OY3wK1Lv

Colombia: @UNHumanRights deeply troubled by the staggering number of human rights defenders killed in Colombia since 2018.

Many of those who lost their lives advocated for the rights of indigenous peoples, Afro-Colombians & women. https://t.co/nngaOsWM0Q

“At a time when there are so many pressing challenges, do not lose sight of the fundamental importance of a peaceful resolution of the Syrian conflict.”

-- @UNEnvoySyria in briefing to Security Council on the 10th anniversary of the conflict. https://t.co/I5PgAm42xh

UN & EU health officials will meet this week on the AstraZeneca #COVID19 vaccine; @WHO chief @DrTedros stresses the greatest threat most countries face now is lack of access to vaccines. https://t.co/zvxnIcr1Nd

"Gender equality is essentially a question of power. We still live in a male-dominated world with a male-dominated culture. This must change."

-- @antonioguterres at the opening of the Commission on the Status of Women. https://t.co/zAiAL0o7l7 #CSW65 https://t.co/MUXUGKzSbN

Myanmar: UN Special Envoy @SchranerBurgen1 strongly condemns violence in the country as the military defies international calls for restraint, dialogue & full respect for human rights & fundamental freedoms. https://t.co/Fi5r7QgGPD

10 years of conflict in Syria.
10 years of suffering, loss & resilience.

Listen to the testimonies of people in Syria as they describe a decade of war & express their hopes for a better future: https://t.co/gsUlduZPwm #Syria10 via @UNOCHA https://t.co/vhFq1zfEpq

Media has a fundamental role to play to stop rape culture.

Let’s change the narrative that places blame on victims and use the power of language in service of survivors, not perpetrators. https://t.co/yfJck9ONOe via @UN_Women https://t.co/mPdLqvXDdW

The UN's largest annual gathering of gender equality champions kicks off on Monday. 

Follow @UN_CSW for more on this year's all-virtual Commission on the Status of Women. https://t.co/WMKmWGJ3mF #CSW65 https://t.co/PRFU2QUPoR

370 million children have missed school meals due to #COVID19 classroom closures. For many, the meals are a key source of daily nutrition.

It costs less than $1 to feed a child for a day.

Use the #ShareTheMeal app & help @WFP achieve #ZeroHunger: https://t.co/h6cesmIr4Y https://t.co/hqSqAnOl8V

⏳ Two weeks
🌍 32 countries
💉 17.5+ million #COVID19 vaccine doses

Follow the historic roll-out of the lifesaving vaccine around the world with @UNICEF. https://t.co/4RRhVD7qX0 https://t.co/FsVkCTRM0n

From hugging our friends to cheering on our favourite teams, so many of us are longing to enjoy the simple pleasures taken from us by #COVID19.

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic, by ensuring people around the world can get a vaccine. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/Sr6JhJmPAr

The next 10 years will be critical for addressing the climate crisis.

2021 is the beginning of the Decade on Ecosystem Restoration, a rallying call for the protection & revival of ecosystems around the world. 

Join #GenerationRestoration: https://t.co/hzVHbZgWeD https://t.co/Q1OeKz4bRm

Globally, only 25% of national parliamentarians are women.

New data shows that despite progress, widespread gender inequalities in politics persist.

https://t.co/T9DqhRkYIm via @UN_Women

The ambitious Great Green Wall initiative across Africa is supported by the UN and aims to:

✅ Restore degraded land
✅ Create green jobs
✅ Protect biodiversity
✅ Achieve #ZeroHunger

More from @IFAD ⤵️  https://t.co/HT6cZYscNV

▪️ Syria 
▪️ Yemen
▪️ Democratic Republic of Congo
▪️ Central African Republic 
▪️ Sahel region 
▪️ Myanmar & Bangladesh 
▪️ Afghanistan 
▪️ Ethiopia 
▪️ Mozambique 

@UNOCHA highlights 10 concerning crises & how you can help those living through them. https://t.co/UOBSbtdGRn

A year into the #COVID19 pandemic, more must be done to build back greener.

Recovery spending has fallen short, with only 18% of nations’ announced recovery spending commitments considered ‘green.’ via @UNEP 
https://t.co/rD1tEYwStH

📸: A Pakistani psychologist #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping in the Central African Republic helps child victims of abuse reduce anger and increase self-esteem through art therapy.

More about @UN_CAR's work: https://t.co/JkomO6Vqsb https://t.co/aTCwgVgWSo

"It's really important that every country, every individual, focuses on doing the things that can keep transmission down while we scale up vaccines." 

@WHO's @doctorsoumya on the importance of individual responsibility to stop #COVID19 on Awake At Night. https://t.co/GS6CFWizMK https://t.co/ebm58nlkAn

What we eat, and how that food is produced, affects our health but also the environment.

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero by eating more sustainably -  cook more plant-based meals, buy funny-looking veggies & educate others to do the same. https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 #ActNow https://t.co/58XzDNEnBU

#OnlyTogether can we end this pandemic & get back to the things we love. -- @antonioguterres.

See how the UN family is coming together to ensure everyone, everywhere can get the #COVID19, in our latest @Twittermoments. https://t.co/j3cxhlYsuz

Around the world, incarcerated people have been disproportionately affected by the #COVID19 pandemic.

@UNODC expert says prisoners in nearly every country and on all continents are being negatively impacted by the crisis. https://t.co/BzjPXR6nLw

These are some of the faces of resilience from people trapped in the 🌍's worst humanitarian crisis.

Yemen is on the brink of famine & funding cuts to humanitarian aid threaten to increase suffering. 

Donate & help save lives: https://t.co/W7Ywr0zT10 https://t.co/DCWxC4bwUl

We are all eager to return to the things we love.

#OnlyTogether can we ensure people everywhere can get a #COVID19 vaccine & bring the pandemic to an end. 

See how leaders & governments expressed support for ensuring everyone is protected. https://t.co/sLpDVFbCin

Indigenous peoples continue to face barriers to their rights to lands, territories & resources.

More in @UNDESA's latest report. https://t.co/iCxEzcrxlZ #WeAreIndigenous

Top crime prevention & criminal justice experts express concern about inequalities exposed by #COVID19 & urge greater efforts to achieve #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/exvdIFnJ5e 

https://t.co/R7cdpDOPUm

People in Syria are facing the worst humanitarian situation since the start of the conflict a decade ago, with nearly 12.5 million going hungry. 

@WFP provides food assistance to people like Diana, a 10-year-old Syrian refugee who has only known war. https://t.co/dLH2aRvzCX https://t.co/5kGROHWuGr

People with chronic kidney disease are more likely to develop severe symptoms from #COVID19.
@pahowho has more details on Friday's #WorldKidneyDay: https://t.co/17yr0Iug1l https://t.co/pVPwEIr9T6

💉 Delivering vaccines
🧼 Improving sanitation & hygiene
🦠 Increasing virus detection capabilities 

See how the UN is helping to bring an end to the #COVID19 crisis in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/bG62G1g86X

“The people of Myanmar need not only words of support but supportive action."

-- @UNHumanRights independent expert warns Myanmar junta's response to peaceful protests likely meets the legal threshold for crimes against humanity. https://t.co/emk8Xg7j5f

“As a mediator you need a small mouth, big eyes & big ears, because you have to keep listening, especially to what is not said.” 

@UN_GP_RtoP's Alice Nderitu shares her experience mediating conflict on our Awake At Night podcast with @MelissaFleming. https://t.co/yDn5YkbSw0 https://t.co/LEPVAaZKGI

As the world enters the second year of the pandemic, the impact of the crisis will be felt for generations to come.

@UNICEF has more on the devastating impact of #COVID19 on our children. https://t.co/MOtTOy0qSx

“If you don't feed people, you feed conflict.”

-- @antonioguterres urges Security Council to do everything possible to end violence & alleviate people's suffering amid multiple conflict-driven famines globally, worsened by climate shocks & #COVID19.

https://t.co/qpy21UfJRf https://t.co/HwkUSiF4PP

Together we have the power to end the pandemic faster – but only if people around the world can get a vaccine. 

#OnlyTogether can we ensure everyone is protected so we can get back to the things we love. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/UKoqohSqlh

Healthy, well-nourished children learn better.

@WFP's school feeding programmes help ensure kids from the world's most vulnerable families can thrive & achieve their full potential. More on Thursday's Int'l School Meals Day: https://t.co/Ri4U6jGeNR https://t.co/QYslkUUaSH

Myanmar: UN Security Council strongly condemns violence against peaceful protestors following last month's military takeover. 
https://t.co/EifgyA9jMe

370 million children have missed daily meals due to school closures amid #COVID19.
On Thursday's Int'l School Meals Day, @WFP is calling on countries to prioritize children's health & wellbeing in their pandemic recovery plans. https://t.co/Ri4U6jGeNR

https://t.co/LCQ6Lq7eWG

.@Eritrea_UN's @stesfamariam is one of only a few African women serving as their country's Ambassador at UNHQ. 

In @africarenewal, she talks about her priorities, the challenges & why she is keen to present a fresh narrative of her country to the world. 
https://t.co/qCBHyfs0ff https://t.co/GKxT4k0TVg

.@WFP is the world's largest provider of school meals, which offer millions of children long term benefits for: 

📚 Education
🍚 Nutrition & health
👧 Gender equality
🌾 Local economies

More on Thursday's International School Meals Day: https://t.co/Ri4U6jGeNR https://t.co/03LP0H9nAI

Our careless misuse of natural resources comes at a high cost, including the climate crisis, pollution & mass extinction.

On Wednesday, countries at the UN decided to #MakeNatureCount in economic reporting to help measure and protect our natural capital. 
https://t.co/RZoj2FRPEM https://t.co/iQDgVZK0zd

School meals are often the only source of nutrition for millions of children.

Amid #COVID19, @WFP has continued to provide this life-saving assistance, including through take-home rations. 

Thursday is International School Meals Day: https://t.co/Ri4U6jXPFp https://t.co/SmYfMAxeL0

"For ten years, the world has watched Syria spiral into destruction and bloodshed. 
In that time, Syrians have been subjected to human rights violations on a massive and systematic scale." 
-- @antonioguterres
https://t.co/JnzZHOEztD

Despite increases in the number of women at the highest levels of political power, widespread gender inequalities persist.

New data shows growth but also setbacks when it comes to achieving gender equality in political decision-making. https://t.co/wFa9MmXnLL via @IPUparliament https://t.co/mm8o5lXgUA

🔌 Green energy
🚆 Green transport
🏡 Green buildings
📈 Green research & development
🌳 Natural capital

These policy areas can deliver the economic returns needed for a strong #COVID19 recovery while addressing environmental & social concerns. https://t.co/JPRbzLi8y6 via @UNEP https://t.co/K8bIibo3Z0

We are in this together - and #OnlyTogether will we end the pandemic. 

Amid the #COVID19 crisis, people around the world are showing acts solidarity and kindness. Check out out latest @TwitterMoments for inspiring examples: https://t.co/P8O3UpxDBP

✏️ Facts save lives
🌱 Biodiversity is keeping us alive
👩🏽‍💼 Women's leadership is needed more than ever
12 months into the pandemic, @UNDP shares 12 lessons learned from #COVID19 to build back better & achieve the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/7fAFGlsQzI

https://t.co/noyQOuVynv

Sudan: An inclusive political process will be key for the country's transition towards democratic governance, @volkerperthes, the new head of @UNITAMS, tells the Security Council. https://t.co/XUgGKbdxIT

Climate change is a menace to our world. 

Our league of superheroes is taking #ClimateAction and they want YOU to join them! 

Get to know them all and find out how you can #ActNow: https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 https://t.co/HeG4coZyPn

Temperature extremes in February - with below average temperatures in some regions of the world and above average in parts of the Arctic - highlight new “climate norms", according to @WMO.
https://t.co/mqOSU2kVMn

1 in 3 women & girls experience physical or sexual violence in their lifetime, in most cases by an intimate partner. 

New @WHO study warns that violence frequently starts before women reach their mid-twenties. https://t.co/S2xluanSci https://t.co/dobnG4gBm6

Since 2006, @UNCERF has allocated $7 billion for life-saving emergency response operations in 110 countries.

More on the fund that has been helping people in crises for the last 15 years: https://t.co/jcvFDU7UQi #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/VyrP5H7tZF

Fruits and vegetables are dietary essentials, but many people cannot afford them.
We need to ensure that everyone has access to a healthy diet!
More on the International Year of Fruits & Vegetables from @FAO: https://t.co/Q8jZMHW4lI #IYFV2021

https://t.co/UWE3T4tydZ

Less salt 🧂 = better health 🏃

High salt intake can increase your blood pressure & put your health at risk. 

As Salt Awareness Week gets underway, @pahowho has more on the importance of limiting salt intake: https://t.co/fGlHWWtZjI https://t.co/Mwl2XOFY5Q

According to @UNWTO:
🔒 32% of travel destinations are completely closed for international tourism
🔓 34% of destinations are partially closed
🧪 32% of destinations request a PCR or antigen test
✈️ 2% of destinations lifted #COVID19 restrictions 
https://t.co/73a6FCl2aF

On Monday’s #InternationalWomensDay, the UN celebrated women and their invaluable contributions around the world. 

See some examples in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/PtbRX3rTzD

"If we measure it, if we are aware of it, we can take care of it." 

-- UN Chief Economist Elliott Harris explains why it's important to #MakeNatureCount, in order to protect our natural capital. https://t.co/24MOqWF1Xh https://t.co/GRPRMPMg9f

Not a single country has yet achieved gender equality. 

There has been progress, but real change is too slow.

On Monday's #InternationalWomensDay, @UN_Women explains how YOU can help create the gender-equal world we all deserve: https://t.co/qB4dKDxAua https://t.co/yWv8GSq89m

In countries facing conflict, climate change & hunger, women & girls often eat last, and sacrifice their meals first. 

On Monday's #InternationalWomensDay, see how you can help @WFP ensure that no woman or girl goes to bed hungry: https://t.co/lSc3xrCCgE https://t.co/JYdI3gqawj

In Yemen, the scarcity of freshwater means farmers often resort to using water of dubious quality, leaving many gravely ill with cholera. 

Watch & learn how @FAO is working to fight the disease. https://t.co/MkG5H7oBce

https://t.co/N94Eh93dXW

Across the world & across all sectors, women's leadership continues to be underrepresented.

On Monday's #InternationalWomensDay, show your support for breaking down barriers to equal participation. https://t.co/JeR669gwYB via @UN_Women https://t.co/zkpySZyCNz

.@UN_GP_RtoP's Alice Nderitu is the Special Advisor on the Prevention of Genocide.

In the new episode of Awake At Night, she talks with @MelissaFleming about the important role of women in peace processes & the challenges they face. https://t.co/yDn5YkbSw0 #GenerationEquality https://t.co/1nDQfAYQgw

Pandemic recovery is our chance to leave behind generations of exclusion & inequalities. 

It is time to build an equal future. 
This is a job for everyone – and for the benefit of everyone.

-- @antonioguterres on Monday's #InternationalWomensDay. https://t.co/Xet4mN6JTq https://t.co/uIXk6Fkrme

#COVID19 hasn’t stopped women from taking the lead.

On Monday's #InternationalWomensDay, @UNFPA is celebrating the courageous and lifesaving work of women around the world: https://t.co/Gqgj2VFhqQ #GenerationEquality https://t.co/ClrAbvFgjr

Monday's #InternationalWomensDay is an opportunity to:

☑️ challenge gender norms
☑️ empower each other
☑️ celebrate diversity
☑️ break stereotypes
☑️ take action

More from @UN_Women: https://t.co/20YzMsTKEh https://t.co/O7Yf7O13h5

"Think we're followers? Watch us lead."

Ahead of Monday's #InternationalWomensDay, check out how women #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping around the world are shattering stereotypes. https://t.co/JlWYyEQpfh https://t.co/K123r3npsh

Indigenous communities in the Amazon region have been hit hard by #COVID19, with many losing their livelihoods & suffering from food insecurity.

Humanitarians are supporting the Governments' response to help those most in need. https://t.co/lkqGjh2eqr via @UNOCHA_Americas

Engineering innovations that harness the power of new technologies can help the world achieve the #GlobalGoals.

@UNESCO explores how engineering can transform our world for the better. https://t.co/YRJzVvAU1v https://t.co/T425ISDmzS

Yemen is in the brink of famine and 80% of its population is in need of humanitarian aid.

The UN has called for urgent funding & unhindered access to communities to save lives in the world's worst humanitarian crisis. 

More from @UNOCHA: https://t.co/NpVbzvOOkm #YemenCantWait https://t.co/oby5N6CPpL

"Restoring the ocean’s ability to nurture humanity & regulate the climate is a defining challenge." -- @antonioguterres. 

2021 begins the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development. https://t.co/WFnzu5PWnE #OceanDecade https://t.co/opWm83kDWm

.@UNEP highlights the economic return on sustainable infrastructure:

🔵 Renewable energy plants
🔵 Eco-friendly public buildings &
🔵 Low-carbon transport
https://t.co/72TUww5V0Z

The 14th UN #CrimeCongress gets underway Sunday - it's the world's largest & most diverse gathering of crime prevention and criminal justice experts.

More on their expected discussions, including the link between the rule of law and the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/hJC4dxgb7h https://t.co/9FIqDyTEjy

168 empty desks. 
168 unused backpacks.
168 million children with schools closed due to #COVID19.

@antonioguterres visited the @UNICEF "Pandemic Classroom" at UNHQ, stressing that no effort should be spared to bring children safely back to school. https://t.co/FXafDgBG5Z https://t.co/DwnyWmM0wT

#COVID19 recovery plans must address long-standing gender inequalities to build a fairer & more resilient world. 

Achieving gender equality will also help tackle the climate crisis, boost economic growth & achieve the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/8P3J5BFeOW https://t.co/aNZQxAvllk

Natural resources are not free or endless.

And their misuse comes at a high cost, including the climate crisis, pollution & mass extinction.

It's time to #MakeNatureCount by measuring & protecting our natural capital. https://t.co/g5QJDEInvy https://t.co/aITXZBz6hM

Young people have been among the most affected by #COVID19. 

Now, the @WorldBank wants to hear from them about how they are poised to play a key role in recovering better from the pandemic.

If you are 18-35 years old, submit your video with ideas: https://t.co/34PC2bLmUA https://t.co/krNRnOyJnQ

🗣️ 180+ speakers from 60 countries
💡 1 Main Stage
🤝 5 Interactive Spaces
👥 25 Workshops
🎥 20 Exhibits
🎵 10 Performances
💬 4 Networking Zones
& more!

See how you can help #TurnItAround for people & planet at the @SDGaction Global Festival. https://t.co/Xh9fULRV8z

Around 12 million #COVID19 vaccines have now reached 19 countries through the UN-led COVAX initiative. 

Continued funding for the global vaccination effort is essential to ensure everyone can get vaccinated. 

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/Kz8zTWDqUa https://t.co/UtaVdKe5h5

“I will continue my efforts in solidarity with the people of Myanmar. Their hope will depend on unified support and action from the Security Council.”

-- Special Envoy @SchranerBurgen1 on Friday. 
https://t.co/dhBTEFrtJ9

Millions of tonnes of food are wasted every year around the world. The majority of this food loss takes places in households.

@FAO has tips on how you can reduce food waste in your home. 
https://t.co/cunVOH3M4c

https://t.co/Pl1DHZNFDs

From Côte d'Ivoire to India to Rwanda, the UN is responding to the pandemic, including by helping to ensure equitable access to life-saving #COVID19 vaccines.

Find out more in our latest collection of @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/1THyJUJ0fM

Ahead of Monday's #InternationalWomensDay, a new virtual exhibit from @UN_Women showcases the stories of women leading by example to change the places of power, end violence, achieve #GenerationEquality & more. https://t.co/dZAQzy8Shf https://t.co/rRjM4I2UKc

Seven years after the Security Council called for the destruction of Syria’s chemical weapons programme, there have been only limited developments to bring the country into compliance with its global obligations, says @UN_Disarmament chief @INakamitsu.
https://t.co/tH7hukT3fM

#COVID19 could reverse decades of progress on gender equality.

New @UNDP report shows a temporary basic income could strengthen women's social protection during the pandemic to prevent increasing poverty & rising inequalities. https://t.co/xW903Todzd https://t.co/GCbJQb1MvX
